sentences.en: Fair prospects wed happily with fair times.
sentences.cn: 明媚的景物和明媚的时光,自然能够圆满配合.

sentences.en: Get the scoop on the best age to be wed.
sentences.cn: 现在,让我们对应该何时结婚来探个毕竟吧.

sentences.en: His cousin was about to wed.
I'm afraid that it won't be possible, much as wed like to.
sentences.cn: 尽管我们很想这样做, 但恐怕不行了.

sentences.en: In 1952 she wed film director Roger Vadim.
sentences.cn: 1952年她嫁给了电影导演罗杰·瓦丹。

sentences.en: In the ceremony, Venice was said to be wed to the Sea '.
sentences.cn: 在仪式中, 威尼斯被说是“嫁给了大海 ”.

sentences.en: Outsiders who wed islanders are given only three years' right of abode at first.
sentences.cn: 岛外的人和岛民结婚之初只能获得三年的居住权。

sentences.en: Some people said wed never forget as long as life.
sentences.cn: 有些人说好要刻骨铭心一辈子之久.

sentences.en: The couple eventually wed after three year engagement.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妇在订婚三年后终于结婚了.

sentences.en: The couple wed late at night in front of just nine guests.
sentences.cn: 深夜这对情侣在仅有的9位宾客面前举行了婚礼。

sentences.en: The relative Weighted Euclidean Distance ( WED ) classifier is proposed as an improvement of the classifier.
sentences.cn: 通过对WED ( WeightedEuclidean Distance ) 分类器的改进研究,提出了相对WED分类器 的新概念,进一步提高了系统的识别能力.

sentences.en: They were wed at Amiens last August.
sentences.cn: 他们去年8月在亚眠结婚。

sentences.en: Wed like to recommend our new habitat health monitor.
sentences.cn: 咱们想力荐咱们新的家里成员康健监测器.

sentences.en: You will wed with dry eyes, anyhow.
sentences.cn: 无论如何,你会高高兴兴地结婚的.

words.tran_cn: 结婚的；结合的；已结婚的

trans.tran_en: to marry – used especially in literature or newspapers
